p.dialogue: "I've changed a lot over the years, but I still prefer sunny weather."
"Sometimes I daydream about our retirement... relaxing on the sunny beaches of the Fern Islands!#$e#Do you ever think about the future, @?"
"Good morning! I got up early and baked something sweet for you! [223 234 211 651 731]#$e#I know you're strong, but you still need to eat well to stay at your best!$h"
"I can't go outside today... my hair will go limp. Forgive me, dear.$s#$e#I want to look my best for you."
"Are you going out in this weather? Just make sure to wipe your boots on the way back in, honey.#$e#I'll just stay here and do some housework."
"Say 'goat cheese'!"
"Oh no... If this weather keeps up I'll get so pale.$s"
"Oh, I'm glad you're back. It's so cold in here by myself... Are you almost ready to shut off the lights?"
"I hope it's nice and sunny tomorrow morning. Too much rain can make me moody.$s"
"I hope Emily isn't too lonely all by herself. I should visit her again soon.$7"
"Rain is horrible for a photographer. The lighting is awful, and you can't go outside without ruining your equipment!$s"
"I made a hot meal for you, honey. Lots of spice, just how you like it. Enjoy! [727 231 207 199]$h"
"I never thought I'd say this, but the country lifestyle really suits me.$h"
"Hi, honey. I'm so glad you're home. I was starting to get kind of lonely.$l"
"Good morning! Did you sleep well?$h#$e#I think I might break out the old camera today... the lighting is just perfect."
"Good morning, dear! Smells good, doesn't it? I made you breakfast! [194 195 210 211 216]#$e#I know you're busy with your work. I'm here to support you in any way I can!"
"Did you sleep okay? You were snoring a little.$h#$e#I've got some chores to do in here. Have a good day."
"I'm glad I've learned to enjoy cleaning! The house gets dirty very easily.$10#$e#It's satisfying to get everything squeaky clean.#$e#Can I have a kiss before you leave?$11"
"Good morning, dear. Another day of farm chores, huh?#$e#I'll be thinking of you. <$h"
"I felt like I had no direction in life before I met you. Now I have exactly what I want.$l"
"You look like you've been working hard, dear. Let me help you de-stress.$l"
"I always feel best when I'm outside, breathing fresh air.#$b#Don't get me wrong, your grandpa's old cottage is very nice! But nothing beats this beautiful landscape."
"We've got to make sure the farm is cute! That might be important... right, honey?"
"Hi, honey! If I knew more about farm work I'd help you out more. Sorry!#$e#I'll be thinking of you.$h"
"I'm just going to do some dusting over here. That should help you out, right?#$e#*phew*... it's hot out here."
"Don't overwork yourself, dear.#$e#Make sure and take a break every now and then, or get something to eat.$h"
"Looks like a good day to work on my tan, don't you think, sweetheart?"
"I'm going to socialize in town for a bit today."
"It was nice seeing everyone in town. Did you have a good day, dear?"
"Isn't it strange? I'm not used to being a mother."
"Isn't %kid2 a very good-looking baby?"
"A big house, two kids, and a beautiful plot of land. I'm not sure what else I could ask for."
"So, what are we planting this season?"
"Now that winter's over, we've got lots of sunny weather to look forward to. I'm excited."
"Sorry if I don't look my best... the air is just so humid that my hair doesn't hold up too well."
"It's summer... that means the house is full of flies and ants... yuck.$s"
"I already miss summer..."
"Fall is kind of sad for me... everything is dying.$5"
"My skin feels so dry in this weather."
"For some reason, the snowy weather gives me cravings for pink cake..."
"Aren't you glad winter's over, honey? Things seem more hopeful now."
"I love watching the fireflies on a hot summer's night. It's the closest I'll ever come to visiting the stars."
"Even though I prefer summer, fall might be the best season to take pictures. Those long, low shadows..."
"I was just thinking about the time you helped me open a jar of pickles. Remember that?$h#$e#We've come a long way since then.$l"
